Time to Pivot

18 Feb 2014

When I started this blog in September I was going to share my thoughts about teams, organizations and how they evolve over time. I wanted to share my experience. It happened I was lost that time. I was jiggling with multiple options and couldn’t choose what I truly wanted.

Looking back, I realize many of my posts were not sincere. I wasn't insanely passioned about the subject.

Now I have one. And it's not sex, drugs or rock-n-roll.

We launched a new product Kudobox  a couple of weeks ago. It's an extremely intuitive and fast-to-use service for sharing your appreciations with others.

Being small and simple, it brings me an ocean of positive emotions. You know why?

It constantly brings positive emotions to others.

Kudobox is also a challenge. We’re a bunch of very motivated developers who worked together before. We have a great experience in product development and have a lot of theoretical knowledge how startups should be run.

Can we convert our past experience and deep theoretical knowledge to a product which brings both happiness and money?

I do not know :). But it's something I want to share with you.

From this time forth I will share stories how and why we do different things in Kudobox and what we learn from it.

Stay tuned!
